result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Mehling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No possession of any firearms, including any muzzle-loaders.  No contact whatsoever with J. Smith and/or R. Rice.

Court does not order destruction of the Remington Arms Model 7400 30-06 with a serial number 8012301.  The weapon is to be retained by the Waushara Co Sheriff's Department pending further investigation in an attempt to locate the legitimate owner.  If the owner is not located within 1 year from the sentencing date, the District Attorney is to notify the Court for an order on destruction of the firearm.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L. Mehling

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:45 PM: Defendant Robert L. Mehling in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by DA - joint recommendation. Def and counsel concur w/recital.  Per DA:  As to firearm, weapon recovered, requests that firearm not be destroyed due to pending investigation as to that firearm.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Statement by Def:   None offered.  The Court: Accepts resolution - 8 mos WCJ - I/S - GT, Huber and No TS credit if revoked -  S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  No possession of any firearms including any muzzle loaders; No contact with J. Smith and/or R. Rice; Court Costs with DNA Surcharge - 60 DTP or PP; 30 odd 6 involved to be retained by WCSD pending further investigation in an attempt to locate its legimitate owner.  If not located with in 1 yr from today's date, DA to notify the Court for order on destruction.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 4, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Case Called @ 3:40 PM: Defendant Robert L. Mehling in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA believes matter has been resolved with a probationary sentence.  SPD and Def concur w/recital.   P/S Scheduled.  Court will clear scheduled Jury Trial and any FPT.  NOH Given.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on February 4, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
from DA's Office requesting a STC be scheduled prior to the JT - Granted by the court

Case called @ 3:01 p.m. Defendant Robert L. Mehling in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Blader - DE will waive preliminary hearing and pre-trial motions to be addressed today. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG Plea entered. DA Blader previously represented the defendant. The defendant waives any potential conflict with DA Blader proceeding as the prosecutor on this case. Standard motions in limine filed by the State. Atty Szilagyi voices no objection to the motions in limine filed by the State. The court finds that the defendant stipulates to the fact that he did have knowledge of his status as a convicted felon. The court also finds that the defendant stipulates to the fact that the State need not provide the firearm allegedly possessed by the defendant but can provide a photograph of the firearm.
